post_text:
CURRENT/RETURNING STUDENT INFORMATION UPDATE:

These forms need to be completed even if you are distance learning. An email from Suzanne Schillinger via PowerSchool, subject line reading ‚ÄúAshford School Returning Student Registration for (your child's name)‚Äù has been sent out. Please click on the link in the email or head to our website, www.ashfordct.org and click on the Registration paw print (left-hand side) and click on the RETURNING STUDENTS paw print and follow the instructions. Please complete this before school starts so there are no delays in getting devices handed out and other important matters. Families can begin picking up device(s) starting on Monday, August 31st.

If you have any questions, issues with the forms or do not have access to the Internet, please contact Suzanne Schillinger at 860-429-6419 x317, to discuss options on how to complete the update.

Thank you for your attention to this very important matter.

post_text:
In need of a summer reading book?

Ashford School now has a little library by the school's greenhouse. The little library is stocked with brand new books and new titles are being added regularly. The selection currently includes BB-8 on the Run, Rey's Story, Flush, Beka Cooper, Cinder, and Tales of the Peculiar. Once you take a book, it is yours to keep. Peruse the flyer for a sneak peek of more books that will be available this summer or drop by the little library anytime and pick up some new books for summer reading.( Please do not return or donate books to the little library.)

post_text:
Just because it is a rainy day does not mean you can't get active !

Online Activities:
Try GoNoodle with your family (gonoodle.com)
Try Cosmic Kids Yoga: (https://www.youtube.com/user/CosmicKidsYoga)
Mind Yeti Meditation (mindyeti.com)
Glenn Higgins Fitness Videos: Workout videos performed by your favorite superhero.
Be Harry Potter in the ‚ÄúEnchanted Spells Workout‚Äù or the characters of the Avengers in their ‚ÄúTraining Academy‚Äù (https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvuT1Bjs2VSF0Yqahj8VAKBwyYFnLJIDa)

Send pictures of you being active to Mr. A and Miss Noheimer!
Mr. A: rackerson@ashfordct.org
Miss Noheimer: snoheimer@ashfordct.org

3. Next, type in your student ID: student‚Äôs first and last name separated by a period.

post_text: WOLF DEN is designed to motivate, emphasize, and accentuate the natural desire and instinct to learn possessed by each of our students in grades 5-8. An essential part of the learning process is the independent processing and practice of information, concepts, and skills. Students will use this valuable time to advance their learning! Wolf Den is not break time. Each student is responsible for informing the supervising teacher how they will spend their time. Wolf Den is every other day for grades 5 and 6, and on Tuesdays and Thursdays for grades 7 and 8.

post_text:
Please come and check out our Ashford School kitchen & cafeteria when
you visit the school open house on Thursday, September 26, 6:30-7:30.There will be light refreshments, you can see the many breakfast and lunch
offerings that are available to the students. There will be printed
October breakfast & lunch menus for you to take home, information
regarding online account payments and any questions you may have
answered.
We look forward to seeing you then!
